channel.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
channel.description:
Anyone know of any sites besides gnomez peer where you get paid to leave a program running?
[url=http://www.gomezpeerzone.com/application-apply/?Referrer=wjfouraker0122]http://www.gomezpeerzone.com/application-apply/?Referrer=wjfouraker0122[/url]

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:50, topic:434418”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=537139.msg3995951#msg3995951 date=1337275304]

^I enjoyed that post

no need to announce it…

[size=1pt]no need to point quote my post and announce that there is no need to announce it.[/size]

I guess it all boils down to a very long post I made before talking about the differences in people who remained in Europe (who don’t mind high taxes and a big government telling them whats best for them) and those who moved to America who despised all of those things.

We might have a big government, but at least it doesn’t get controlled by big corporations.

Tbh, id rather have our country ran by a big corporation then the current system of government. Who are the corporations backed by? The people. Who backs up the government? Oil.
[/quote]
not sure if sarcasm…[/quote]

to add: not sure if properly educated…

Read full topic

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I agree with RSC. It shouldn’t be about turning a government into a business, but rather turning a government into a projection of the people’s desires (what else could it be?)

Worth noting that a lot of people in this topic seem to hate capitalism in general, though that hardly surprises me.

Read full topic
item.source: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Tbh, id rather have our country ran by a big corporation then the current system of government. Who are the corporations backed by? The people. Who backs up the government? Oil.

Corporations aren’t backed by the people. Only a handful (relatively speaking) own those corporations, and they operate purely for the profit of those people. In essence it’s not a bad thing, but the influence of these corporations on the government should be limited. The government should exist for the better of all, which can mean that they should give money to corporations, or take money away from them (in the form of taxes).

I’m not for a complete reallocation of wealth, but if the lower income groups can spend more, the economy will grow. ‘Gush up’ economics, instead of trickle down.

Read full topic
item.source: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

We pay a lot for our electric, because of the tax. The supply is already higher than our national demand, and we’re building 2 new coal plants. In 2020, our demand will have risen with about 20%, our supply with 60-70%.

Niall:

I don’t think nor agree that the items you listed are taxed because they should be limited. In the case of alcohol and tobacco, both of these substances are taxed in the UK because both of those substances have a negative affect on society, by taxing the substances the people who end up paying for the damage caused by the substances are the ones who use them.

You say excise taxes are required because these products have a negative effect on society, we say they are required because they have a negative effect on society so the consumption should be limited. That’s only a slight difference.

Of course, a drop in alcohol and tobacco use means less income for the government, but the health risks don’t drop when someone decides to stop using those products. The odds of someone developing lung cancer who had been smoking for the past 25 years are pretty much equal to the odds of someone who has been smoking for the past 25 years and still is smoking. So if you want to make it completely fair, you should raise the insurance bill of those who have an unhealthy lifestyle, and lower that of those who have a healthy lifestyle.

I can already see the riots as a result of such a decision…

Read full topic
item.source: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The deficit is due to too much spending, not a shortage of tax. (see Niall’s comment about “free healthcare”, people have a bad misconception that ‘federal money’ equates to ‘free money’, nothing is ever free, and every dime of government money that is spent has to be paid for)

I just want to point out, I only use the term “free healthcare” in the sense that everyone gets free healthcare, I’ve never had to spend a penny at a hospital bar vending machines. Of course it isn’t free since it’s paid for in taxes, and I dislike the term and usually call it by what it is, national health care/service.

Moparisthebest:

(who don’t mind high taxes and a big government telling them whats best for them)

just nitpicking here, but even in america you still have your states and government telling people what’s best for you, same-sex couples for example don’t receive equal rights in many states and one of the big arguments to keep it that way is “same-sex marriage is against the institution of marriage” or in other words “it’s best for the institution of marriage that same-sex couples can’t get married, therefore they can’t get married because that’s what’s best”

AAAAAAAANd just to point something out, it’s not necessarily cheaper to live in the states because you pay less taxes, you have other costs such as health insurance, everything has to be paid for right?

and again just before I forget, something on the order of 95% of british people find the service of the nhs “fair” or better(with other options including good and excellent) with only 5% finding it “weak”, and while these figures don’t translate into for or against, regardless of what the government supposedly tells us what’s best the british people like their nhs and fight to keep it the way it is

Read full topic
item.source: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?

item.title: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:32, topic:434418”]for more insight into why people put up with it, take a look at your countries deficit

where is the 100% tax figure from, anyway?

it was actually dreamed up by an economist, the intention is to make the industrial cost of things that harm society or the environment equal to the societal cost, otherwise nobody has any incentive to give a shit[/quote]

The deficit is due to too much spending, not a shortage of tax. (see Niall’s comment about “free healthcare”, people have a bad misconception that ‘federal money’ equates to ‘free money’, nothing is ever free, and every dime of government money that is spent has to be paid for)

The over 100% (actually 144%) figure is just some quick math, he R.I.P. RSC says that out of the .22 they pay per kwH of electricity, .13 is tax, so on .09 worth of electricity, they pay .13 tax, which actually works out to 144% tax on electricity, right?

Teh Spede:

I kind of like our healthcare system and different subsidies for various reasons if something happens. We pay 1.8€/l in Finland for gas. We don’t have tolls on big roads like we had in USA.

In my entire life riding in a car, and my slightly over 10 years driving myself, I’ve went through 2 toll roads, one on my way to North Carolina and back, and one on my way to the grand canyon through Oklahoma, I wouldn’t call that a lot of toll roads or anything. (I don’t know of any anywhere near me) That’s more of a local thing where local people choose to either foot the bill for the taxes for a new road, or charge tolls.

I guess it all boils down to a very long post I made before talking about the differences in people who remained in Europe (who don’t mind high taxes and a big government telling them whats best for them) and those who moved to America who despised all of those things.

Read full topic
item.source: Get Paid to Leave Computer On?
